body_html:
I would skip the default behavior of flattening the input. Numpy has been trying to move away from this sort of default behavior, which usually doesn't work very well for multi-dimensional inputs. Safer default behavior would be to raise an error if no axis is provided and the input is not 1D.
…

body:
I would skip the default behavior of flattening the input. Numpy has been
trying to move away from this sort of default behavior, which usually
doesn't work very well for multi-dimensional inputs. Safer default behavior
would be to raise an error if no axis is provided and the input is not 1D.
On Tue, May 2, 2017 at 10:42 AM Vijay Vasudevan <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> Is there any reason not to be feature complete with numpy, if it's easy to
> do?
